mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville lawyer and judge Alfred Thompson Adams, conducted on 16 September 1980 by Leanne Thornton as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Adams, who served Nashville as Chancellor of Part Two of the Davidson County Chancery Court from 1957 to 1970, discusses going to Beersheba Springs and listening to men tell stories about their Civil War experiences. He recounts one story told to him by a former member of Morgan's Cavalry who had been captured. The complete interview is available in the repository.
